definitions.definition: The course of a story , comprising a series of incidents which are gradually unfolded, sometimes by unexpected means.
An area or land used for building on or planting on.

examples: He's buried in the family plot .

definitions.definition: A graph or diagram drawn by hand or produced by a mechanical or electronic device.
A secret plan to achieve an end, the end or means usually being illegal or otherwise questionable.
examples: The plot would have enabled them to get a majority on the board.
The assassination of Lincoln was part of a larger plot .

definitions.definition: Contrivance ; deep reach thought; ability to plot or intrigue.
Participation in any stratagem or conspiracy .
Attractive physical attributes of a fictional character; assets .
examples: Actor X has some great plot near the end of E 07.

main_definition: ( narratology ) The course of a story , comprising a series of incidents which are gradually unfolded, sometimes by unexpected means. [from 1640s]
secondary_definitions: An area or land used for building on or planting on. [from 1550s]
A graph or diagram drawn by hand or produced by a mechanical or electronic device.
A secret plan to achieve an end, the end or means usually being illegal or otherwise questionable. [from 1580s]
Contrivance ; deep reach thought; ability to plot or intrigue.
Participation in any stratagem or conspiracy .
( fandom slang , euphemistic ) Attractive physical attributes of a fictional character; assets .
